fullText: This production of 'She Loves Me' is so thoroughly, intelligently and lovingly considered that it should be bottled as the antidote to Broadway superficiality.
dtliExcerpt: This production of 'She Loves Me' is so thoroughly, intelligently and lovingly considered that it should be bottled as the antidote to Broadway superficiality.
bwwExcerpt: Sometimes vanilla ice cream can taste like sweet deliverance. Such is the discovery made by one Amalia Balash in the 1963 musical 'She Loves Me' -- which has been rapturously revived in a new production by the Roundabout Theater Company -- when she receives a gift of this frozen confection from an unlikely suitor. As Amalia trills her delight in a song that flies toward heaven on ascending high notes, audiences for Scott Ellis's production...are likely to know exactly how she feels. That's partly because 'Vanilla Ice Cream'...is performed by Laura Benanti, an actress whose joyful soprano is a conduit for instant empathy...when embodied by a cast as expertly attuned as this one, which also includes a winning Zachary Levi and a scrumptious Jane Krakowski, it has a lingering and deeply satisfying sweetness usually lacking in brassier shows...The cheerful seamlessness of 'She Loves Me' defies deconstruction.
